description.description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about totalitarianism, surveillance, and the manipulation of truth.
A story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, exploring themes of decadence, idealism, and the American Dream.
A powerful story of racial injustice and the loss of innocence in the American South, told through the eyes of young Scout Finch.
A classic romance novel about the relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy, exploring themes of marriage, class, and personal growth.
A coming-of-age story following Holden Caulfield's journey through New York City, exploring themes of alienation, loss of innocence, and the phoniness of the adult world.
A novel about a group of British boys stranded on an uninhabited island who descend into savagery, exploring the dark side of human nature.
An allegorical novella about a group of farm animals who rebel against their human farmer, only to see their revolution corrupted by power.
A fantasy novel about Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on a quest with thirteen dwarves to reclaim their homeland from a dragon.
An epic high-fantasy novel about the quest to destroy a powerful ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.
A dystopian novel set in a futuristic World State where people are genetically bred and pharmaceutically anesthetized to maintain social stability.
A dystopian novel about a future society where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found, exploring themes of censorship and knowledge.
A novel about a young Andalusian shepherd who dreams of finding a worldly treasure and embarks on a journey to discover his personal legend.
A poetic tale about a young prince who visits various planets in space, exploring themes of love, loss, and the meaning of life.
A powerful story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan's tumultuous history.
A novel set in Nazi Germany, narrated by Death, about a young girl who steals books and shares them with neighbors during bombing raids.
A dystopian novel about a young woman who volunteers to take her sister's place in a televised battle to the death between teenagers.
A young adult novel about two teenagers who meet at a cancer support group and fall in love, exploring themes of life, death, and love.
A psychological thriller about a woman who disappears on her fifth wedding anniversary, and the investigation that follows.
A psychological thriller about a woman who becomes entangled in a missing person investigation after witnessing something from her daily train commute.
A novel about three women whose seemingly perfect lives unravel to the point of murder, exploring themes of friendship, marriage, and motherhood.
A psychological thriller about a woman who shoots her husband and then never speaks again, and the criminal psychotherapist who tries to unravel her motive.
A memoir about a woman who leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.
A memoir by the former First Lady of the United States, sharing her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House.
A groundbreaking narrative of humanity's creation and evolution that explores the ways in which biology and history have defined us.
A guide to breaking bad habits and building good ones, based on proven scientific research about how habits work.
An examination of how habits work and how they can be changed, drawing on scientific research and real-life examples.
A comprehensive overview of the two systems that drive the way we think: the fast, intuitive, and emotional system and the slower, more deliberative, and logical system.
An examination of the factors that contribute to high levels of success, challenging the notion that success is solely based on individual merit.
A book about how we think without thinking, about choices that seem to be made in an instant and why they're often better than carefully considered decisions.
An examination of how little changes can make a big difference, exploring the moment of critical mass, the threshold, the boiling point.

title: Freakonomics
author: Steven D. Levitt & Stephen J. Dubner

description.description: A book that applies economic theory to diverse subjects not ordinarily covered by traditional economists, revealing the hidden side of everything.
An examination of the hidden forces that shape our decisions, revealing why we make the choices we do and how we can make better ones.

title: Nudge
author: Richard H. Thaler & Cass R. Sunstein

description.description: A book about how small changes in the way choices are presented can have a big impact on the decisions people make.
An ancient Chinese text on military strategy and tactics, whose principles have been applied to business, politics, and other competitive endeavors.
A political treatise that offers advice to rulers on how to gain and maintain power, often considered a manual for political manipulation.
A series of personal writings by the Roman Emperor, offering insights into Stoic philosophy and practical wisdom for daily life.
A philosophical dialogue about the nature of justice and the ideal society, exploring themes of education, justice, and the philosopher-king.
A philosophical work that explores the nature of happiness and virtue, arguing that the highest good is eudaimonia, or human flourishing.
An autobiographical work that recounts the author's sinful youth and his conversion to Christianity, exploring themes of sin, grace, and redemption.
An epic poem that describes the author's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise, exploring themes of sin, redemption, and divine justice.
A novel about a man who reads so many chivalric romances that he loses his sanity and decides to become a knight-errant.
A tragedy about the Prince of Denmark who seeks revenge against his uncle for murdering his father and marrying his mother.
A tragedy about a Scottish general who receives a prophecy that he will become King of Scotland and commits regicide to fulfill it.
A tragedy about two young lovers whose deaths ultimately unite their feuding families, exploring themes of love, fate, and family conflict.
A comedy about the events surrounding the marriage of Theseus and Hippolyta, including the adventures of four young Athenian lovers and a group of amateur actors.
A play about a sorcerer who uses his magic to restore his daughter to power and deal with his enemies, exploring themes of power, betrayal, and forgiveness.
A tragedy about an aging king who divides his kingdom among his three daughters, leading to tragic consequences and exploring themes of power, loyalty, and madness.
A tragedy about a Moorish general who is manipulated by his ensign into believing his wife is unfaithful, exploring themes of jealousy, race, and manipulation.
A comedy about a merchant who borrows money from a Jewish moneylender, exploring themes of justice, mercy, and prejudice.
A comedy about two pairs of lovers, exploring themes of love, deception, and the battle of the sexes.
A comedy about twins separated in a shipwreck and the romantic complications that ensue, exploring themes of love, identity, and gender.
A pastoral comedy about love, exile, and reconciliation, set in the Forest of Arden.
A comedy about the courtship of Petruchio and Katherina, exploring themes of marriage, gender roles, and power dynamics.
A comedy about two sets of identical twins separated at birth, leading to a series of mistaken identities and comic situations.
A comedy about two friends who fall in love with the same woman, exploring themes of friendship, love, and loyalty.
A comedy about a king and three lords who swear to avoid women for three years, only to fall in love with a princess and her ladies.
A comedy about a young woman who cures a king and wins the hand of a count, exploring themes of love, class, and gender.
A comedy about a duke who leaves his deputy in charge and disguises himself to observe the deputy's strict enforcement of morality laws.
A romance about a king who becomes jealous of his wife and abandons their daughter, leading to a series of events that eventually bring about reconciliation.
A romance about a king who banishes his daughter's husband and the various adventures and misunderstandings that follow.
A romance about a prince who flees his homeland and experiences various adventures, including shipwrecks and family separation.
A tragicomedy about two friends who fall in love with the same woman, leading to a duel and tragic consequences.
A history play about King Henry V's military campaign in France, culminating in the Battle of Agincourt.
A history play about the rise and fall of Richard III, exploring themes of power, ambition, and the consequences of evil.
A history play about King Henry IV's struggle to maintain his throne and his son Prince Hal's journey from irresponsible youth to responsible leader.
A continuation of the story of King Henry IV and Prince Hal, exploring themes of power, responsibility, and the transition of leadership.
A history play about the deposition of King Richard II by his cousin Henry Bolingbroke, exploring themes of kingship, power, and divine right.
A history play about the early reign of King Henry VI and the beginning of the Wars of the Roses.
A continuation of the story of King Henry VI and the escalating conflict between the houses of Lancaster and York.
The final part of the Henry VI trilogy, depicting the climax of the Wars of the Roses and the rise of the Yorkist faction.
A history play about King Edward III's military campaigns in France and Scotland, exploring themes of kingship and military leadership.
A comedy about Sir John Falstaff and his attempts to seduce two married women, who turn the tables on him.
A comedy about Sir John Falstaff and his attempts to seduce two married women, who turn the tables on him.
A tragicomedy set during the Trojan War, exploring themes of love, war, and the futility of conflict.
A tragedy about a Roman general who is banished from Rome and allies with his former enemies, exploring themes of pride, politics, and military leadership.
A revenge tragedy about a Roman general who seeks vengeance for the crimes committed against his family, featuring extreme violence and bloodshed.
A tragedy about a wealthy Athenian who gives away his fortune and is abandoned by his friends, leading to his misanthropy and eventual death.
A tragedy about the conspiracy to assassinate Julius Caesar and the consequences that follow, exploring themes of power, betrayal, and political ambition.
A tragedy about the love affair between Mark Antony and Cleopatra, and their eventual downfall, exploring themes of love, power, and political intrigue.

title: The Life and Death of King John
author: William Shakespeare

description.description: A history play about King John's struggle to maintain his throne against various challengers, exploring themes of kingship and political legitimacy.

title: The Famous History of the Life of King Henry VIII
author: William Shakespeare

description.description: A history play about the reign of King Henry VIII, focusing on his marriages and the political and religious changes of his reign.

title: The Life of King Henry V
author: William Shakespeare

description.description: A history play about King Henry V's military campaign in France, culminating in the Battle of Agincourt and his marriage to Catherine of Valois.

title: The First Part of King Henry IV
author: William Shakespeare

title: The Second Part of King Henry IV
author: William Shakespeare

title: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
author: William Shakespeare

title: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
author: William Shakespeare

title: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
author: William Shakespeare

title: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
author: William Shakespeare

description.description: The final part of the Henry VI trilogy, depicting the climax of the Wars of the Roses and the rise of the Yorkist faction.

title: The Life and Death of King Richard the Third
author: William Shakespeare

description.description: A history play about the rise and fall of Richard III, exploring themes of power, ambition, and the consequences of evil.

title: The Life of King Henry the Fifth
author: William Shakespeare
